content:
• Tuesday, January 22, 2013
  • CSX

    More on CSX Corp. (NYSE:CSX): Q4 comes in-line on a slight beat to the revenue side, despite a...

    More on CSX Corp. (NYSE:CSX): Q4 comes in-line on a slight beat to the revenue side, despite a slight 2% slip in total sales Y/Y. Net earnings also declined 3.1% as coal shipments slumped by 19%, largely due to a reduction in demand from utilities, though intermodal volume improved by 3.6% and automotive volumes climbed by 10%. Shares +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • BNNY

    Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) recalls its frozen-pizza products due to possible fragments of metal mesh...

    Annie's (NYSE:BNNY) recalls its frozen-pizza products due to possible fragments of metal mesh found in flour and pizza dough from a third-party supplier. The action is likely to weigh on sales for the organic-food maker, and creates another headache in its attempt to move into the frozen-food aisle. Shares -14% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM
  • CREE

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CREE +15%. ISRG +9%. GOOG +5%. IBM +4%. SNE +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CREE +15%. ISRG +9%. GOOG +5%. IBM +4%. SNE +2%.
    After-hours top losers: STRI -21%. BNNY -11%. WCC -4%. SNH -3%. IVR -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • ISRG

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 beats across the board as total revenues jump on an...

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 beats across the board as total revenues jump on an 18% Y/Y surge in sales of its da Vinci Surgical System. The company saw 25% growth in procedures, spurred on by increased gynecology and general surgeries in its U.S. market, which helped to offset a decline in prostate surgeries. Sales of instruments and accessories, which are used in procedures, were up 29% over the prior year period. Shares +9.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • CREE

    More on Cree: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $325M-$345M and EPS of $0.30-$0.35, above a...

    More on Cree: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $325M-$345M and EPS of $0.30-$0.35, above a consensus of $322.5M and $0.28. The margin improvements continue: FQ2 gross margin was 39.2%, up 170 bps Q/Q and 390 bps Y/Y. FQ3 gross margin of ~39.5% expected. Opex +17% Y/Y as lighting investments ramp. LED products 58% of revenue (+4% Y/Y), lighting products 35% (+25%), power and RF products 7% (+59%). CREE +14.5% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • NJR

    New Jersey Resources (NYSE:NJR) +1.8% AH after announcing FY 2013 EPS guidance of $2.55-$2.75...

    New Jersey Resources (NYSE:NJR) +1.8% AH after announcing FY 2013 EPS guidance of $2.55-$2.75 vs. $2.48 consensus. As usual, NJR expects New Jersey Natural Gas to be the top contributor to earnings, driven by a steadily improving customer growth rate of 1.3%-1.4%, accelerated infrastructure investments and gross margin from incentive programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • DWCH

    Datawatch (NASDAQ:DWCH): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $6.82M (+9% Y/Y) misses by...

    Datawatch (NASDAQ:DWCH): FQ1 EPS of $0.11 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $6.82M (+9% Y/Y) misses by $1.1M. Shares -9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • STRI

    STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) -19.3% AH after the provider of components used in solar modules...

    STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) -19.3% AH after the provider of components used in solar modules says it expects First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR), its largest customer, to switch to a new supplier during the next few months, causing a "material adverse effect" on its business. STR adds it plans to conduct a major restructuring, and recently hired UBS to evaluate strategic alternatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH) says preliminary quarter-to-date net orders for FQ1 were 750 through January...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH) says preliminary quarter-to-date net orders for FQ1 were 750 through January 18, representing an increase of 54% Y/Y. However, the home builder notes that relative improvement is expected to moderate as the quarter continues. It also announces a $250M secondary offering consisting of $100M in common stock and $150M of convertible senior notes due 2019. Citigroup, Credit Suisse, BAMA and Deutsche Bank will act as joint book-running managers. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.16B (-32%...

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q4 EPS of -$0.14 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.16B (-32% Y/Y) beats by $0.01B. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • IBM

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q4 EPS of $5.39 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $29.30B (-0.6% Y/Y) beats by $210M....

    IBM (NYSE:IBM): Q4 EPS of $5.39 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $29.30B (-0.6% Y/Y) beats by $210M. Expects 2013 EPS of at least $16.70, above consensus of $16.63. Shares +4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 10 Comments
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q4 EPS of $1.3 beats by $0.1. Revenue of $2.7B (-4% Y/Y) beats by...

    Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q4 EPS of $1.3 beats by $0.1. Revenue of $2.7B (-4% Y/Y) beats by $0.04B. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • GOOG

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q4 EPS of $10.65 beats by $0.13. Revenue (exc. traffic acquisition costs)...

    Google (NASDAQ:GOOG): Q4 EPS of $10.65 beats by $0.13. Revenue (exc. traffic acquisition costs) of $11.34B (+39% Y/Y, boosted by Motorola) misses by $1.12B. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 9 Comments
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS of $4.25 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $609M (+23% Y/Y)...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q4 EPS of $4.25 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $609M (+23% Y/Y) beats by $24.79M. Shares +3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $271.2M beats by $25.59M....

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD): Q4 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $271.2M beats by $25.59M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +4.6%) says it plans to drill a minimum of four Utica test wells in Ohio this...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +4.6%) says it plans to drill a minimum of four Utica test wells in Ohio this year, with further development on the leasehold position expected later in the year. The first well will be a vertical pilot for extensive logging and coring, then plans are to plug back and drill a ~6K-ft. lateral in the Point Pleasant portion of the Utica.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 8 Comments
  • CHK

    Shares of natural gas producers Chesapeake (CHK +5.3%) and Southwestern Energy (SWN +2.9%) rally...

    Shares of natural gas producers Chesapeake (CHK +5.3%) and Southwestern Energy (SWN +2.9%) rally as a dangerous cold snap hits the eastern and midwestern U.S., boosting demand and prices for the fuel. The east coast is seeing "some of the coldest weather in two years," Kilduff Report analysts say. The cold is expected to continue, according to extended forecasts.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 11 Comments
  • ATHX

    Athersys (ATHX +6.4%) gets a boost today, possibly from an upbeat Seeking Alpha piece that touts...

    Athersys (ATHX +6.4%) gets a boost today, possibly from an upbeat Seeking Alpha piece that touts its strong pipeline. ATHX is a clinical stage biopharmaceutical company with a number of potential catalysts in its portfolio. Its most advanced programs are in the area of regenerative medicine using its stem cell therapy called MultiStem for the treatment of ischemic stroke. StemCells (STEM -2.3%) slips, possibly on the same article, which says it's in pre-clinical trials for the same indication, but its product isn't as advanced as that of ATHX.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • RF

    As opposed to many other lenders, Regions Financial (RF +4.4%) saw no deterioration in its net...

    As opposed to many other lenders, Regions Financial (RF +4.4%) saw no deterioration in its net interest margin in Q4. It remained at 3.08% and it may improve in 2013, thanks to $8.3B in maturing CDs (CC transcript) with rates in the 0.5%-1.5% range that could be replaced with ones in the 0.20% area. (earnings presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD +1.5%) expects 2013 EPS to climb to $3.85-$4.05 on sales of $36B but foresees a...

    DuPont (DD +1.5%) expects 2013 EPS to climb to $3.85-$4.05 on sales of $36B but foresees a "modest decline” in profit during Q1-Q2, CFO Nicholas Fanandakis says. Margins in performance chemicals may narrow by 7-9 percentage points in 2013; without that unit, earnings would rise in the "high teens." Look for a couple of soft quarters before things firm up, an Edward Jones analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +7%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at BMO, which says...

    Goodrich Petroleum (GDP +7%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at BMO, which says the stock's recent "cleansing" presents a favorable risk/reward in which to gain exposure to exploration efforts targeting the Tuscaloosa Marine Shale. GDP's Eagle Ford-driven 2013 game plan carries little risk of negative surprise.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +3.9%) adds to Friday's gains after Canaccord raises its PT to $75 from $48,...

    3D Systems (DDD +3.9%) adds to Friday's gains after Canaccord raises its PT to $75 from $48, while reiterating a Buy. Separately, Piper says talks with resellers and other contacts lead it to believe both 3D and Stratasys (SSYS +1%) will deliver better-than-expected Q4 results. Piper upgraded both companies in November.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 4 Comments
  • OMN

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -1.2%) slips after its Q4 slide to a smaller-than-expected profit in as...

    Omnova Solutions (OMN -1.2%) slips after its Q4 slide to a smaller-than-expected profit in as lower volume and price cuts hurt the building-materials maker's bottom line. Sales slipped 16% Y/Y as stepped-up competition and weak market demand hurt sales of paper chemicals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • NFG

    Raymond James describes initial results from the six Marcellus Shale wells recently completed by...

    Raymond James describes initial results from the six Marcellus Shale wells recently completed by National Fuel Gas (NFG +4.2%), whose peak production rates were averaging 17.8M cf/day, as "massive... fantastic... Five of these wells represented the highest peak production rates of any wells operated by NFG in the Marcellus."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +5.1%) is among the day's top gainers after posting better-than-expected...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +5.1%) is among the day's top gainers after posting better-than-expected earnings and copper sales. CEO Richard Adkerson foresees improvement in U.S. copper demand, predicting 20% volume growth in 2013 followed by another 15% in 2014, and says copper costs should drop ~10% to $1.35/lb. by year-end 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • TECH

    Techne Corporation (TECH -2.2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at CLSA. The firm cites...

    Techne Corporation (TECH -2.2%) slips on a downgrade to Underperform at CLSA. The firm cites ongoing uncertainty regarding the company's CEO replacement and associated costs, plus earnings volatility. The firm also lowers its price target to $70 from $77 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • VECO

    Veeco (VECO +2.8%) trades higher after announcing Chinese LED maker KaiStar has placed an order...

    Veeco (VECO +2.8%) trades higher after announcing Chinese LED maker KaiStar has placed an order for the company's TurboDisc manufacturing systems, including Veeco's new/costly MaxBright product. Meanwhile, rival Aixtron (AIXG -4.4%) is having a bad day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • ECTE

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -6%) slips despite presenting positive results from an expanded...

    Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -6%) slips despite presenting positive results from an expanded analysis of data collected from clinical studies of its Symphony tCGM glucose monitoring system in critically ill patients at Tufts Medical Center in Boston. The data was presented during over the weekend at the Society of Critical Care Medicine's 42nd Critical Care Congress.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • ANIK

    Anika Therapeutics (ANIK +3%) says that it expects FY12 and Q4 to come in better than...

    Anika Therapeutics (ANIK +3%) says that it expects FY12 and Q4 to come in better than expections. Q4 revenue should come in around $22M - $23M, above the current consensus estimate of $20.6M. For FY12, it expects to equal or exceed its previously announced guidance of $0.74 net income per diluted share. Additionally it's appointed Sylvia Cheung as its new CFO, effective April 1, 2013. Cheung will replace Kevin Quinlan, who is leaving effective March 31, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • NFG

    National Fuel Gas (NFG +5%) reports "significant" results on 6 recently-completed Marcellus...

    National Fuel Gas (NFG +5%) reports "significant" results on 6 recently-completed Marcellus Shale wells. The stock is a former favorite of Mario Gabelli, and he's bullish again (Barron's Roundtable), arguing the sum of the parts is greater than the whole. The pipeline business alone is worth $20-$25/share if spun into an MLP, he says.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK +3.3%) is selling a 12.1% stake to Chinese solar peer Fulai Investment for...

    LDK Solar (LDK +3.3%) is selling a 12.1% stake to Chinese solar peer Fulai Investment for $31.1M. Fulai is buying 17M LDK shares at a price of $1.83 (LDK's Friday closing price), and is gaining the right to nominate two board members. The investment comes 6 weeks after LDK, which is holding $3.1B in debt, disclosed it's in talks with creditors "to obtain additional flexibility." Like many other solar names, shares have been on a tear since then.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • AMGN

    Amgen (AMGN +1%) shrugs off an early dip to trade higher even after Credit Suisse cut the shares...

    Amgen (AMGN +1%) shrugs off an early dip to trade higher even after Credit Suisse cut the shares to Neutral and lowered its price target to $90. The firm says the 3 key elements to its upgrade in July have been realized and there are few catalysts remaining in the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • LMST

    Midday top 10 gainers: PBIB +32%. DQ +18%. TECUA +18%. ONP +17%. USEG +17%. RDCM +17%. CIMT...

    Midday top 10 gainers: PBIB +32%. DQ +18%. TECUA +18%. ONP +17%. USEG +17%. RDCM +17%. CIMT +14%. BOX-OLD +14%. MTRX +12%. PRCP +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OTC:CALI -12%. OIBR -12%. BVX -10%. DOM -9%. ARNA -8%. IIVI -8%. AMRI -8%. UPI -8%. IPXL -8%. EXFO -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +1.9%) gains after Burrill Institutional Research initiated the...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +1.9%) gains after Burrill Institutional Research initiated the shares with a Market Outperform on valuation and a price target of $5 a share. The firm says the stock represents an undervalued opportunity with multiple near-term drivers that are likely to create shareholder value in 2013. Separately, Aegis Capital starts the stock with a Hold rating and a $3.00 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    "We hope to see RIM remain a global leader and player, and make sure it grows organically," says...

    "We hope to see RIM remain a global leader and player, and make sure it grows organically," says Canada's Industry Minister, suggesting his government might object to a sale of RIM's (RIMM +9.6%) hardware ops. Thorsten Heins suggested a hardware sale is possible in his interview, but it doesn't look as if one is planned over the near-term. RIM remains sharply higher following Heins' interview, new BB10 leaks, and an upgrade to Sector Outperform from Scotia Capital - Scotia upgraded RIM to Sector Perform only 4 months ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +4.1%) gets a pop after Roth Capital adds it to its Focus List and...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO +4.1%) gets a pop after Roth Capital adds it to its Focus List and calls it a top 2013 Biotech pick. The firm cites optimism over its lead product TSO and its potential for treating Crohn's disease, and assigns a whopping price target of $24 on the shares, representing a +350% premiuim to its current price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • RNN

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +4.9%) trades higher today after saying it's appointed Dr. Peter D....

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +4.9%) trades higher today after saying it's appointed Dr. Peter D. Suzdak as its new chief executive officer. Dr. Suzdak succeeds Dr. Chang Ahn, who was recently appointed as the company's chief scientist. Dr. Ahn will also remain as chairman of the company's board of directors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • MTRX

    Matrix Service (MTRX +9%) is upgraded to Overweight with an $18 price target, up from $12, by...

    Matrix Service (MTRX +9%) is upgraded to Overweight with an $18 price target, up from $12, by Stephens, which expects the supplier of storage tanks and aftermarket tank products to report a strong FQ2. The firm cites MTRX's healthy refinery turnaround activity in its oil, gas and chemical segment, and a boost from higher-margin storm response work post-Hurricane Sandy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • EXAC

    Exactech (EXAC +2.8%) a maker of orthopaedic implant devices, moves up after saying it expects...

    Exactech (EXAC +2.8%) a maker of orthopaedic implant devices, moves up after saying it expects to report Q4 revenues of $60M due to a 13% Y/Y jump in sales of its hip implants in both its U.S. and international markets. The Street had projected revenues to be $57M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • CRK

    Comstock Resources (CRK -2%) expects to take a Q4 impairment charge of ~$78M, which amounts to...

    Comstock Resources (CRK -2%) expects to take a Q4 impairment charge of ~$78M, which amounts to $51M after tax or $1.10/share, related to unevaluated leases which aren't expected to be developed prior to their expiration and certain developed natural gas properties. CRK plans to spend $420M in drilling and completion expenditures and $25M on lease acquisitions in 2013 vs. $490M and $35M spent in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • PETS

    PetMed Express (PETS +2.9%) gets a lift as its FQ3 beats on the bottom line. Net earnings jumped...

    PetMed Express (PETS +2.9%) gets a lift as its FQ3 beats on the bottom line. Net earnings jumped 17% as the retail pet pharmacy benefited from stronger margins and a 10% Y/Y decline in operating expenses. Rising costs had pressured margins in the past, but the company's become more aggressive in pricing and was able to offset soft sales trends by shifting to higher-margin items like generics and expanding its product line-up. Gross margin rose to 34.7% from 34%

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • OMG

    OM Group (OMG +9.1%) agrees to sell its advanced materials business for $325M to a JV that...

    OM Group (OMG +9.1%) agrees to sell its advanced materials business for $325M to a JV that includes Freeport McMoRan (NYSE:FCX); OMG says it also may receive up to an additional $110M based upon certain revenue targets over a three-year period. OMG says the sale is in line with its strategy to shift toward technology-based businesses with attractive growth prospects and more predictable profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • IIVI

    II-VI (IIVI -9.3%) takes a hit this morning after its FQ2 revenue and reduced fiscal-year...

    II-VI (IIVI -9.3%) takes a hit this morning after its FQ2 revenue and reduced fiscal-year expectations disappointed across the board. Bookings rebounded to post a 9% increase Y/Y for the aerospace and electronic products maker, but revenue weakened late in the quarter, driven by a deteriorating defense budget outlook. The company also issued weak FY13 guidance, now expecting to earn between $0.91 - $0.99 per share on revenues of $560M - $570M. The Street view is for an EPS of $1.01 on revenues of $593.75M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY +4.2%) trades higher to reach a two-month high without any specific company news...

    Best Buy (BBY +4.2%) trades higher to reach a two-month high without any specific company news pushing sentiment. The buzz over Dell's own P-E deal could be bringing some investors back into the fold.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • DQ

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ +19%) surge again, capping off a near doubling in the past month,...

    Shares of Daqo New Energy (DQ +19%) surge again, capping off a near doubling in the past month, as China's polysilicon plants resume output to meet a demand recovery expected when the country imposes a retaliatory tax on foreign imports of the material. But the rally may be nearing its end as foreign suppliers find ways to circumvent duties and Chinese plants compete with each other in a crowded market.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.7%) resumes its January rally after ITG Research says checks lead it to forecast...

    Facebook (FB +3.7%) resumes its January rally after ITG Research says checks lead it to forecast Q4 North American sales of $780M-$800M, above a $771M consensus. Also, Oppenheimer reports U.S. mobile Facebook usage rose 15% M/M in December (per comScore), and takes this data as evidence Facebook's efforts to ramp mobile ad impressions hasn't hurt engagement - some have worried this will happen.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 4 Comments
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +4%) trades higher after announcing it recently bought Arkeia, a provider...

    Western Digital (WDC +4%) trades higher after announcing it recently bought Arkeia, a provider of storage backup software and VMware backup appliances for SMBs. The purchase expands WDC's enterprise lineup - the company already offers NAS servers  for SMBs - and (as The Register observes) puts it in competition with Seagate's (STX +1.4%) EVault backup/recovery product line. It also helps WDC lower its PC dependence a bit at a time when doing so seems a good idea.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) slides 7.8% and adds to a 6.5% loss on Friday after the EU's...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) slides 7.8% and adds to a 6.5% loss on Friday after the EU's CHMP health regulator didn't make a decision about approving the company's Belviq weight-loss treatment at meetings last week, meaning the firm will have to wait for at least another month for a ruling. It doesn't help that Arena received a 180-day list of questions about Belviq. "It's not pretty," says Adam Feuerstein. (Arena 8-K)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) plans to offer $1B in senior notes due 2023, looking to use the...

    Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) plans to offer $1B in senior notes due 2023, looking to use the proceeds to buy back notes due in 2016; remaining proceeds will be used to repay debt and for general corporate needs. Last week, Conoco Phillips agreed to sell acreage in Montana and North Dakota to DNR for $1.05B.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) says Canada's Department of Fisheries and Oceans approved its...

    Thompson Creek Metals (NASDAQ:TC) says Canada's Department of Fisheries and Oceans approved its fish habitat compensation plan, marking the final step to authorize deposition of tailings material into the zero discharge tailings storage facility at its Mt. Milligan project and the final authorization required to operate the Mt. Milligan copper-gold mine. TC +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD) gain 4.2% in premarket action after Jim Cramer gave the stock...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD) gain 4.2% in premarket action after Jim Cramer gave the stock exposure on the Friday edition of Mad Money. The company is in the midst of a global expansion push that is at a moderate pace than its U.S. explosion of a few year ago that crippled its financials. Cramer points out that even with a recent run in share price, Krispy Kreme trades with a lighter earnings multiple than Dunkin' Brands and is growing earnings faster.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market Preview: Stock futures tilt higher after being flat earlier as investors return from the...

    Market Preview: Stock futures tilt higher after being flat earlier as investors return from the long weekend, with the S&P benchmark +0.3%. Factors that could be boosting sentiment include GOP moves to extend the debt ceiling and surprisingly strong optimism among German investors. RIM jumps 6.4% on news it may eventually sell its hardware production and license its software. Following earnings, Verizon is +0.8%, DuPont is +1.1% and J&J is -0.7%. Calendar: Existing Home Sales, Richmond Fed Mfg., major tech earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PAAS

    Pan American Silver (NASDAQ:PAAS) +1.5% premarket on news it produced a record 6.9M oz. of...

    Pan American Silver (NASDAQ:PAAS) +1.5% premarket on news it produced a record 6.9M oz. of silver during Q4 and a new annual production record of 25.1M oz. for full-year 2012. PAAS also produced a record 32,381 oz. of gold during Q4, lifting annual production to a record 112,283 oz. Expects production of 25M-26M oz. of silver and 140K-150K oz. of gold in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • BOX-OLD

    Premarket gainers: BOX-OLD +13%. CLSN +11%. EBR +8%. RIMM +7%.Losers: OIBR -11%. ARNA -7%. JW.A...

    Premarket gainers: BOX-OLD +13%. CLSN +11%. EBR +8%. RIMM +7%.
    Losers: OIBR -11%. ARNA -7%. JW.A -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BB

    RIM (RIMM) shares +7.1% premarket after hitting a 13-month high in Canada yesterday following a German newspaper interview with CEO Thorsten Heins in which said the company could sell its hardware production or license its software to rivals.

  • Asian are mostly lower, with Japanese stocks falling as the yen rises after the BOJ announced...

    Asian are mostly lower, with Japanese stocks falling as the yen rises after the BOJ announced well-telegraphed further easing measures but said it will wait until next year to begin open-ended asset purchases. "The big question now is will the combined fiscal and monetary stimulus work?" asks investment strategist Stephen Corry. "The yen does look oversold and the Nikkei looks overbought."
